alert.note: Alert for Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 2:08PM CST until January 26 at 2:16PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River at Riverside affecting Polk, San Jacinto, Walker and Trinity Counties. Trinity River near Goodrich affecting Polk, Liberty and San Jacinto Counties. Long King Creek near Livingston affecting Polk and San Jacinto Counties. Caney Creek near Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Wharton, Fort Bend and Brazoria Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Menard Creek near Rye affecting Liberty, Hardin and Polk Counties. Peach Creek at Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Colorado River at Columbus affecting Wharton and Colorado Counties. For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor, Goodrich, Liberty, Moss Bluff...Major flooding is forecast. For the Long King Creek...including Livingston...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Peach Creek...including Splendora...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Sublime. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, Major lowland flooding continues with the river one quarter mile wide at the Highway 90A bridge threat ending livestock from the headwaters to below Speaks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 25.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 PM CST Wednesday was 25.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 30.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning to 9.7 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will rise to 10.9 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.5 feet on 06/07/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Navidad River Sublime 24.0 25.2 Wed 1 pm CST 30.0 17.7 9.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tonight.Thursday morning at 815 AM CST.
